data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
data.sentence: The word رَبُّهُمْ comes from the root ر ب ب and is associated with the meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.

data.meanings: To lie, say what is not a fact, lie to falsely invent, tell lies about or against, fabricate a lie, relate a lie, say a falsehood, be wrong, be cut off, deceive, disappoint the expectation of.
data.sentence: The word فَكَذَّبُوهُ comes from the root ك ذ ب and is associated with the meanings: To lie, say what is not a fact, lie to falsely invent, tell lies about or against, fabricate a lie, relate a lie, say a falsehood, be wrong, be cut off, deceive, disappoint the expectation of.

data.meanings: to cut/wound/slay, hamstrung, produce no result, be barren (e.g. womb).
data.sentence: The word فَعَقَرُوهَا comes from the root ع ق ر and is associated with the meanings: to cut/wound/slay, hamstrung, produce no result, be barren (e.g. womb).

data.meanings: to track, make a tale, add apendix, follow closely, become spotted.Commit offence, fault, sin, wrong, act of disobedience, transgression.
data.sentence: The word بِذَنْبِهِمْ comes from the root ذ ن ب and is associated with the meanings: to track, make a tale, add apendix, follow closely, become spotted.Commit offence, fault, sin, wrong, act of disobedience, transgression.

data.meanings: to be worth, equivalent to. sawwa - to level, complete, arrange, make uniform, even, congruous, consistent in parts, fashion in a suitable manner, make adapted to the exigencies or requirements, perfect a thing, put a thing into a right or good state. istawa - to establish, become firm or firmly settled, turn to a thing, to direct one's attention to a thing, mount. ala sawain - on terms of equality, i.e. in such a manner that each party should know that it is free of its obligations, at par. sawiyyun  -even, right, sound in mind and body. sawiyyan - being in sound health.. sawwa (vb. 2) to proportion, fashion, perfect, level, equal, fill the space. sawa - midst.
data.sentence: The word فَسَوَّاهَا comes from the root س و ي and is associated with the meanings: to be worth, equivalent to. sawwa - to level, complete, arrange, make uniform, even, congruous, consistent in parts, fashion in a suitable manner, make adapted to the exigencies or requirements, perfect a thing, put a thing into a right or good state. istawa - to establish, become firm or firmly settled, turn to a thing, to direct one's attention to a thing, mount. ala sawain - on terms of equality, i.e. in such a manner that each party should know that it is free of its obligations, at par. sawiyyun  -even, right, sound in mind and body. sawiyyan - being in sound health.. sawwa (vb. 2) to proportion, fashion, perfect, level, equal, fill the space. sawa - midst.

data.meanings: He smeared or did over, a thing much, or exceedingly, or with energy: and he so covered over a thing.
data.sentence: The word فَدَمْدَمَ comes from the root د م د م and is associated with the meanings: He smeared or did over, a thing much, or exceedingly, or with energy: and he so covered over a thing.
